violations.excerpt: name does not meet format requirements
package name similar to existing packages

discussion.author: mohamed-barakat
discussion.text: The CAP project was initiated in 2015 as part of two dissertations in computer algebra. CAP is the name of the core package. It is already part of the [GAP distribution](https://www.gap-system.org/packages/) under this three-letter name. [CAP.jl](https://github.com/homalg-project/CAP.jl/) is now completely independent from GAP (and also from the registered [GAP.jl](https://github.com/oscar-system/GAP.jl)). The package [CAP.jl](https://github.com/homalg-project/CAP.jl/) gives native Julia access to the core package of the [CAP project](https://homalg-project.github.io/docs/CAP_project-based/), which, unlike [GAP.jl](https://github.com/oscar-system/GAP.jl), can finally run under Windows without the need of the linux subsystem. This will allow for a wider user base in computer algebra.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
[noblock] Not a fan of these three-letter acronyms as package names, but I suppose, having GAP, the "spin-off" CAP follows a pattern. So I guess this should be okay.

P.S.: But you'll need support from someone with full merge permissions, which isn't me

discussion.author: mohamed-barakat
discussion.text:
> [noblock] Not a fan of these three-letter acronyms as package names, but I suppose, having GAP, the "spin-off" CAP follows a pattern. So I guess this should be okay.

Thank you very much, Michael.

> P.S.: But you'll need support from someone with full merge permissions, which isn't me

Do I need to contact a specific person?

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: After the three-day waiting periods ends, you can ask in the `#pkg-registration` channel on Slack

discussion.author: carstenbauer
discussion.text:
I agree with @goerz in that we should merge this although it's not optimal.

But one more question: Can we expect this to be the last short acronym named package from this area for the foreseeable future?

discussion.author: mohamed-barakat
discussion.text:
> I agree with @goerz in that we should merge this although it's not optimal.

Thank you very much to both of you.

> But one more question: Can we expect this to be the last short acronym named package from this area for the foreseeable future?

Yes, all the other CAP-based packages have names longer than 5 characters :)

https://homalg-project.github.io/docs/CAP_project-based/#packages-part-of-or-based-on-cap_project

discussion.author: mohamed-barakat
discussion.text: P.S. QPA2 is not managed by our team and would probably not be ported to Julia.
